description: Surroundings• Rural• In or near a town• Hilly • Woods and fields• Agricultural ground• Quiet rural area with no trafficJust 5 km from exit 27 (Tournus) of the Route du Soleil, you will find our charming 18th century wine farm with its vineyard and gite. La Montagne Gîtes & Chambres d'Hôtes is situated in a cul de sac on top of a hill with the Burgundy vineyards at the back and a wonderful front view.

reviews.text: An 18th century house set in a stunning landscape looking out towards Tournus. Just 10 minutes from the A6 it is ideally placed for people travelling to and from the South of France. The bedrooms have a real charm about them and are all very inkeeping with the age of the house. Unfortunately, the bathrooms in both of the rooms we booked were fairly modern, clean and fit for purpose but were totally out of keeping with the style of the house. It appeared as if very cheap bathrooms had been installed with absolutely no character at the least possible price. The toilet seats particularly were the flimsiest any of us had come across. An evening meal is provided at €20 per person which I would recommend - not necessarily for the cooking which is just about adequate but nothing special - but because you probably wouldn't want to get the car out to drive all the way into Tournus for a meal. The stay was very good value - the rooms, the evening meal and the drinks. Our host was very helpful and friendly but I have to say that personally I think the hostess does not enjoy running a bed and breakfast. She was very polite to us but she did moan a lot about the business and how dreadful some of their customers are. Overall we did enjoy it but with a little more thought and effort on the part of the owners, this could be a truly wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: Could be wonderful

name: La Montagne Gites & Chambres d'Hotes
